scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying thereâ€™s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. You chose to prioritize your time off and asked your colleague to reach out to another person. Later, you meet with [Monica] and [Bob] at a team gathering. [Monica] glances at you with a concerned expression, 'Hey [Alex], I heard you didn't help with the urgent task while you were on leave. [Bob] had to stay late to cover for you. What happened?' You suggest a constructive approach, saying, 'It was a tough call. Maybe we should discuss better ways to handle such situations in the future.' [Bob] nods slightly, but he still looks a bit annoyed. '[Bob] crosses his arms and raises an eyebrow, 'Discussing is fine, but it doesn't change the fact that someone has to do the work. Why couldn't you just take a quick look?' You downplay the situation and say, 'Well, I didn't see it as a big deal at the moment. We all need breaks, right?' [Monica] and [Bob] exchange glances, and the tension in the room thickens.
scenes.description: [Monica] takes a deep breath and asks, 'So, [Alex], do you think you could handle things differently next time to avoid such issues?'

options.text: Maybe, but it's hard to say without knowing all the circumstances.
